snippet: The so-called Jenkins case asks for the overturning of an N.C.A.A. rule that bars compensation beyond scholarships to top-tier football and Division I men’s basketball players.
abstract: Experts say if NCAA loses so-called Jenkins case, antitrust lawsuit that argues athletic scholarships unlawfully cap player compensation, it could be far more damaging than O'Bannon ruling, which allows universities to share revenue with athletes.
lead_paragraph: The so-called Jenkins case asks for the overturning of an N.C.A.A. rule that bars compensation beyond scholarships to top-tier football and Division I men’s basketball players.

headline.print_headline: Case That Could Erode Amateur Model Takes Step
headline.main: Case That Could Erode Amateur Model Takes a Small Step
